value.name: faqpage
value.label: FAQ rich markup
value.help: Only use FAQPage if your page has a list of questions with answers

value.name: collapsible
value.label: Allow All Items To Be Closed

value.name: close_first
value.label: Close First Item
value.help: Enable to close the first item

value.name: prepare_content
value.label: Prepare content
value.help: Optionally prepare the content with the Joomla Content Plugins.

schema.name: faqpage
schema.label: FAQ rich markup
schema.help: Only use FAQPage if your page has a list of questions with answers

schema.name: collapsible
schema.label: Allow All Items To Be Closed

schema.name: close_first
schema.label: Close First Item
schema.help: Enable to close the first item

schema.name: prepare_content
schema.label: Prepare content
schema.help: Optionally prepare the content with the Joomla Content Plugins.

value.name: sticky_animation
value.label: Sticky Animation
value.help: Add an animation in order to have the sticky element reappear smoothly.

value.name: sticky_bottom
value.label: Sticky Bottom
value.help: Bind the sticky behavior to a specific element, so that it disappears after scrolling past that point of the page.

value.name: sticky_show_on_up
value.label: Sticky on scroll up
value.help: You can make the sticky element show only when scrolling up to save space. Together with an animation, this makes for a very smooth experience.

value.name: sticky_media
value.label: Responsive
value.help: The element will be sticky from the specified viewport width and upwards, but not below. Only numbers allowed.

value.name: sticky_offset
value.label: Offset
value.help: You can position the element below the viewport edge.

value.name: animation_repeat
value.label: Animation Repeat
value.help: Applies animation every time the element is in view

schema.help: Applies animation every time the element is in view

value.name: id
value.label: Css ID
value.help: Add your custom ID WITHOUT the '#'. eg - my-id

value.name: class
value.label: Css Class
value.help: Add your custom classes WITHOUT the dot and seperate by space. eg - first-class another-class
